titleStmt.title: Daniel W. Lindsey, General Orders, No. 9
CWG13998

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

body.p:
Adjutant Generals Office
Frankfort April 5. 1865.
General Orders
No 9.

A Military Court Martial is hereby ordered to convene at the Inspector Generals Office Frankfort Ky on this the 5' day of April 1865, or as soon thereafter as practicable, for the trial of such prisoners as may be brught before them.
The following Officers are hereby detailed and will constitute said Court viz

Maj C. W. Quiggens
Maj W. H. Hays
Lieut W. E. Cox Judge Advocate
No other Officers than those named can be assembled without manifest inquiry to the service

Said detail will also constitute a Commission to investigate and ascertain the correctness of certain claims laid against the State by all Officers of the 30' Ky Vol Infy for services rendered the State previous to being mustered into the U. S. service, who will report their opinion as to same. No other Officers than those named can be assembled for this Commission without manifest inquiry to the service Court will sit without regard to hours

By order of the Governor
D, W, Lindsey
Adj' Genl of Ky
